briefTitle: Efficacy and Safety of Two Treatment Algorithms in Adults With Moderate to Severe Crohn's Disease
officialTitle: An Open-Label, Multicenter, Efficacy and Safety Study to Evaluate Two Treatment Algorithms in Subjects With Moderate to Severe Crohn's Disease
summary: The primary objective of this study was to demonstrate that tight control of disease activity, using stringent criteria based on Crohn's disease activity Index (CDAI), biomarkers (high sensitivity C-reactive protein \[hs-CRP\] and fecal calprotectin), and corticosteroid use, improves the rate of mucosal healing 48 weeks after randomization compared with management using less stringent criteria based only on CDAI and corticosteroid use.

primaryOutcome.measure: Percentage of Participants With Mucosal Healing and No Deep Ulcerations
